block.p: Robin Lynn Segal, the daughter of Dr. Joy Segal and Michael Segal of Chicago, was married on Friday to John David Edelman, a son of Ruth and Daniel Edelman, also of Chicago. Judge Anne Burke of the Illinois Appellate Court in Chicago, officiated at the Jens Jensen Preserve, a landmark and a home of the bride's parents in Ravinia, Ill.

The bride, 33, is keeping her name. She is of counsel to the Near North National Group, an insurance brokerage firm in Chicago of which her father is the owner and chairman. Her mother is a private and corporate consultant on work and family issues in Chicago.

Judge Anne Burke of the Illinois Appellate Court in Chicago, officiated at the Jens Jensen Preserve, a landmark and a home of the bride's parents in Ravinia, Ill.

The bride, 33, is keeping her name. She is of counsel to the Near North National Group, an insurance brokerage firm in Chicago of which her father is the owner and chairman. Her mother is a private and corporate consultant on work and family issues in Chicago.

The bride sits on the boards of the Lupus Institute of America in Chicago, of which she is a founder, and the Chicago Botanical Gardens. She graduated from Vassar College, received a law degree from Georgetown and also holds a master's degree in philosophy from the University of Chicago.

The bridegroom, 42, is the managing director for human resources at Edelman Public Relations Worldwide, the public relations company in Chicago; his father is its chairman and founder. His mother is a member of the board of directors of the Wellness Center at the Rush-Presbyterian-St. Luke's Medical Center in Chicago and the Brain Research Center at the University of Chicago Hospitals and Health System.
The bridegroom graduated from Brown and received a master's degree in management from Northwestern. His first marriage ended in divorce.
